articles.title: Vietnam puts 12 people on trial for alleged subversion
articles.description: HANOI, Vietnam (AP) — A court in Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh City on Tuesday began the trial of 12 people, including two American citizens, on subversion charges as government authorities step up a crackdown on dissent.

articles.title: Washington sues sham breast cancer charity
articles.description: SEATTLE (AP) — A court found that a sham charity took millions of dollars from Washington residents donating to help fight breast cancer.

articles.title: Police: Pair sex trafficked girl, 16, through 5 states
articles.description: MYRTLE BEACH, S.C. (AP) — Police in South Carolina say two people trafficked a 16-year-old girl for sex through five states.

articles.author: By DUSAN STOJANOVIC Associated Press
articles.title: Serbia takes delivery of 2 Russian fighter jets
articles.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Serbia's air force on Tuesday took the delivery of two Russian MiG-29 fighter jets, part of an arms purchase that could heighten tensions in the Balkans and increase Moscow's influence in the region.

articles.author: By BEATRICE CHRISTOFARO Associated Press
articles.title: Shootouts leave 13 dead, including 2 soldiers, in Rio
articles.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — At least 11 suspects and two soldiers died during shootouts with military personnel and police in greater Rio de Janeiro on Monday as violence erupted in several areas of the city that hosted the Summer…

articles.title: How to puzzle out the next committee chairmen
articles.description: Warren proposes bill to limit lobbying

articles.author: Avery Anapol
articles.title: Lawmakers move to award posthumous Congressional Gold Medal to Aretha Franklin
articles.description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers has taken legislative action to posthumously award a Congressional Gold Medal to music legend Aretha Franklin.In a...

articles.author: By BRENDAN FARRINGTON Associated Press
articles.title: Dem candidates bring diversity to Florida governor's race
articles.description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) — Of the five major Democrats running for Florida governor, only one reflects the type of candidate that historically has been elected to lead the state: a white, Christian man.

articles.title: In his guilty plea, Michael Cohen says hush money payments to women were made "at the direction" of Trump
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In his guilty plea, Michael Cohen says hush money payments to women were made "at the direction" of Trump .

articles.title: The Latest: Polls open for Wyoming's primary election

articles.title: Poll finds bipartisan support for boosting teacher pay
articles.description: FLOTUS calls for educating kids on social media — California lawmakers press DeVos on transgender student rights

articles.title: Vermont's transgender gov. candidate getting death threats
articles.description: MONTPELIER, Vt. (AP) — Vermont's transgender gubernatorial candidate says she's been getting a steady stream of death threats and other personal attacks since her candidacy began to gain traction.

articles.title: Wagner clarifies that he'd veto anti-same-sex marriage bill
articles.description: HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Republican Scott Wagner's campaign is clarifying that he'd veto any bill that restricts marriage rights for same-sex couples after the gubernatorial candidate suggested that he'd consider signing legislation ending recognition of same-s…

articles.title: Human remains found along railroad tracks in St. Louis
articles.description: ST. LOUIS (AP) — Homicide detectives are investigating the discovery of human remains along a stretch of railroad tracks in St. Louis.

articles.title: Former banker avoids jail time for 'upskirt' videos
articles.description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass. (AP) — A former Massachusetts banker who pleaded guilty to taking "upskirt" videos of three women at his bank will not serve any jail time.

articles.author: By SOPHIA BOLLAG Associated Press
articles.title: California law to ban male guard pat downs of female inmates
articles.description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) — Male prison guards will be prohibited from pat-down searching incarcerated women and viewing them while they are not fully dressed under a new law signed by California Gov. Jerry Brown.

articles.author: By LEANNE ITALIE AP Entertainment Writer
articles.title: Logic stages immigrant protest at VMAs with parents, kids
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Wearing white T-shirts with the message "We are All Human Beings," more than two dozen immigrant children and their parents joined Logic and Ryan Tedder on stage Monday night at the MTV Video Music Awards to…

articles.title: Businesses fail to comply with gender neutral bathroom law
articles.description: MONTPELIER, Vt. (AP) — A Vermont state official says many business owners are not complying with a new state law that requires all single-stall bathrooms to be labeled gender neutral.

articles.title: Israeli military to probe deadly shootings along Gaza border
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The Israeli military says it is investigating two recent cases of lethal fire along the Gaza border that killed Palestinian teen protesters.

articles.title: New Mexico officer gets probation for kicking inmate
articles.description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — A New Mexico corrections officer has pleaded no contest for punching and kicking an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center.
